intro: Strychnos distichophylla, commonly known as the two-leaf strychnos, is a deciduous shrub native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by bright orange-red berries containing toxic seeds. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies due to its unique morphology and chemical composition.
